main_definition: To formally suggest someone as a candidate or recipient of an award, honor, or position.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To propose someone for consideration in a selection process
meanings_and_examples.example: The board members were responsible for nominating candidates for the company's executive positions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put forward as a candidate for election or appointment to an office or honor
meanings_and_examples.example: Several individuals were nominated for the role of president in their respective political parties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To submit someone's name as a choice for recognition, award, or prize
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher nominated one student for academic excellence and another for outstanding community service.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To recommend someone to join an elite group or club
meanings_and_examples.example: He was pleased when his peers nominated him as a member of the prestigious book club.
